Let $a,b,c$ be real numbers with $a$ non-zero. It is known that the real numbers $x_1,x_2,\ldots,x_n$ satisfy the $n$ equations:\\
\[  ax_1^2+bx_1+c = x_{2} \]\[ ax_2^2+bx_2 +c = x_3\]\[ \ldots \quad \ldots \quad \ldots \quad \ldots\]\[ ax_n^2+bx_n+c = x_1  \] Prove that the system has \textbf{zero}, <u>one</u> or \textit{more than one} real solutions if $(b-1)^2-4ac$ is \textbf{negative}, equal to <u>zero</u> or \textit{positive} respectively.
